meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of revulsion or strong disapproval.
meanings.sent1: The rotten food in the fridge was so disgustful that I had to throw it away immediately.
meanings.sent2: The garbage left on the street was disgustful and needed to be cleaned up.
meanings.sent3: The way he slurped his soup was disgustful, but it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the abandoned house was so disgustful, it seemed to emit an aura of decay.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the overflowing trash can was disgustful, lingering in the air for hours.

meanings.sent1: Her expression turned disgustful when she saw the mess in the room.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so disgustful that many people walked out of the theater.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reaction to the new food was disgustful, as it refused to even sniff it.
meanings.sent4: The pond was disgustful, covered in a thick layer of green algae.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk was disgustful, making me gag instantly.

meanings.definition: Evoking a strong feeling of dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley had a disgustful aura that made people avoid it at all costs.
meanings.sent2: The politician's actions were so disgustful that even their supporters turned away.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs may seem disgustful, but in some cultures, it's a delicacy.
meanings.sent4: The old, tattered doll had a disgustful appearance, sending shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The sound of nails on a chalkboard is universally disgustful, causing discomfort to many.
